result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Lee Harris Jr

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.

10:09 AM Defendant Willie Lee Harris Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling appeared by video for Willie Lee Harris Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Lee Harris Jr not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel is unavailable due to vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Willie Lee Harris not in court, in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court hears arguments as to bail.  For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to bail.  Defense still waiting for discovery.  Preliminary hearing to remain calendared for August 30, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of bail, filed.

Defendant Willie Lee Harris not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for status. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Lee Harris not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. According to SPD the defendant needs to be interviewed to determine if he's eligible for appointment of counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Willie Lee Harris in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Willie Lee Harris in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie Lee Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 3.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
